message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses compressed sensing problems and the RIP recovery condition, which are topics commonly studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Signal Processing (cs.SP) sub-categories. The paper also presents a novel result on convex k-sparse decomposition, which could be of interest to researchers in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper's focus on invariance with respect to the ell_1 norm suggests that it may also be relevant to researchers in the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category, where the ell_1 norm is commonly used in network analysis.
